meanings.definition: To adopt or support (a cause, belief, or way of life)
meanings.sent1: She espoused the idea of helping those in need by volunteering at the local shelter.
meanings.sent2: Many people espoused the importance of recycling to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The cat espoused the belief that all boxes belong to her and refused to share.
meanings.sent4: His actions espoused his dedication to living a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's passion for education was espoused through her tireless efforts to help her students succeed.

meanings.definition: To marry or engage in marriage
meanings.sent1: They espoused in a beautiful ceremony surrounded by family and friends.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, it is common for individuals to espouse at a young age.
meanings.sent3: The two socks were so in love that they decided to espouse and live happily ever after in the sock drawer.
meanings.sent4: The union of the two companies was espoused to create a stronger business partnership.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tradition of espousing was a symbol of commitment and unity in the community.
